article.title: Information Retrieval and Documentation in Chemistry
article.author: Davis, C.H.
article.text: For several years we have thought that greater effort should be expended to create more understanding of the processes involved in information storage, retrieval, and dissemination. Too often, concepts deriving from science and technology are made to seem unnecessarily abstruse, either inadvertently or deliberately to preserve some sort of mystique. This book is intended to explicate, if not popularize, major aspects of I S and R processes as they are exemplified by the field of chemical documentation. To the extent that this work is found useful by chemists, information specialists, and all individuals interested in scientific documentation, we shall be gratified.
